frontMatter.title: Configuring Sentry's SAML2 Provider with Keycloak
frontMatter.summary: This time, I integrated Sentry with Keycloak. There are several helpful blog posts available that make the process easy to follow. However, out of curiosity, I wanted to understand exactly what was happening behind the scenesâ€”and clarify which steps are truly necessary.

prev.title: Writing Helm Values With Gemini
prev.summary: I often write values.yaml files to install open-source projects on Kubernetes clusters. This time, I needed to add tolerations to ensure all components of Sentry would run on specific nodes. Since Sentry has quite a few components, I decided to leverage Gemini to generate the values.yaml file more quickly.

next.title: Unexpected Trace Data Behavior in Google Cloud Trace with OpenTelemetry
next.summary: My system exports telemetry data from a Node.js application using OpenTelemetry. I configured the OpenTelemetry Collector to send that data to a GCP-managed service via the Google Cloud Exporter. Later, while reviewing database query information from the application, I noticed something odd in the trace data. As I dug deeper, I discovered some limitations of GCP Cloud Trace and how the mysql2 instrumentation package sets attribute values. That investigation helped explain the strange behavior I was seeing in the trace data.
